Verse: One day a doctor named Paulus returned from the market to his village named Terpen. While Paulus had been at the market, some people had told him about a certain disease. So when Paulus returned to his village, he said to Isak, who was the village chief, and the other people who lived in Terpen, “A new disease named Avian Influenza is killing most of the birds that are at the market. This disease killed many chickens and many ducks.

Many people who own chickens and ducks are very sick. They are in the clinic. This disease is in many countries and is killing many people.~!~(NP (AdjP many ) people [ who[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP own ) (NP chicken+s[Plural] ) (NP and duck+s[Plural] ) ] ) (VP are ) (AdjP very[Degree] sick ) . (NP they ) (VP are ) (NP in the[Article] clinic ) . (NP this[Proximity] disease ) (VP is ) (NP in (AdjP many ) countri+es[Plural] ) [ and (NP ) (VP is kill+ing[Participle] ) (NP (AdjP many ) people ) ] .

Guards are watching the farms that have many chickens. Veterinarians who know about this disease go to the market each day. They examine the birds. If a bird catches this disease, they put it in a special cage. Then they give a vaccine to that bird. They burn birds that die because of this disease.~!~(NP guard+s[Plural] ) (VP are watch+ing[Participle] ) (NP the[Article] farm+s[Plural] [ that[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP have ) (NP (AdjP many ) chicken+s[Plural] ) ] ) . (NP they ) (VP burn ) (NP bird+s[Plural] [ that[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP die ) (NP because_of this[Proximity] disease ) ] ) .
People stopped watching roosters fight other roosters because some roosters died because of this disease. When roosters fight other roosters, germs move from the sick rooster to the other rooster.”

Chief Isak asked Paulus, “How does this disease spread?” Paulus answered, “When people touch birds that have this disease, they catch it. And when animals touch birds that have this disease, they catch it.

People, animals, and birds carry this disease from one place to another place. The germs travel through the air. This disease causes people, animals, and birds to become very sick. When people catch this disease, they think that they have a cold. But this disease kills people quickly.”

The people who lived in Terpen started worrying about their families and their chickens. So Chief Isak asked all of the people to come to a meeting. Then the people started talking to each other about this disease. They wanted to prevent this disease from spreading. They didn't want their families or their chickens to catch this disease. So they decided to protect the village from this disease. They decided to do these things.~!~(NP the[Pre-Nominal] people [ who[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP liv+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP in Terpen ) ] ) (VP started[Pre-Verbal] worry+ing[Participle] ) (NP about (NP _ their ) famili+es[Plural] ) (NP and (NP _ their ) chicken+s[Plural] ) . so (NP (NP _ Chief ) Isak ) (VP ask+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP (AdjP all of ) the[Pre-Nominal] people ) [ (NP ) (VP to[Pre-Verbal] come ) (NP to a[Pre-Nominal] meeting ) ] . then (NP the[Pre-Nominal] people ) (VP started[Pre-Verbal] talk+ing[Participle] ) (NP to each_other ) (NP about this[Pre-Nominal] disease ) . 1) The people will build fences for their chickens. They'll give clean food and clean water to their chickens. They'll also clean the chickens' cages. 2) They'll carry their chickens to the market in bamboo cages. After the people sell the chickens at the market, they'll burn the cages at the market. 3) Before the people return to the village, they'll wash themselves with soap in the river.~!~1) (NP the[Article] people ) (VP will[INFL] build ) (NP fence+s[Plural] ) (NP for (NP _ their ) chicken+s[Plural] ) . 6) If a person sees a chicken that has this disease, he has to tell Paulus or Isak about it. 7) People who live in other villages must not bring chickens, eggs, or manure to Terpen.

8) When people who work for the government examine the people's chickens, they'll give vaccine to them.~!~8) [ when (NP people [ who[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP work ) (NP for the[Article] government ) ] ) (VP examine ) (NP (NP _ the[Article] people+`s[Saxon_Genitive] ) chicken+s[Plural] ) , ] (NP they ) (VP will[INFL] give ) (NP vaccine ) (NP to them ) .
9) When people sell their chickens and eggs, they have to save one tenth of the money that they receive to buy vaccine and more chickens.

That evening a man named Nano saw that his rooster was sick. The rooster's comb was big and blue. Pus was coming from the rooster's eyes and his beak. And the rooster's foot was red. The rooster also wasn't able to crow.~!~(NP that[Pre-Nominal] evening ) (NP a[Pre-Nominal] man (NP named Nano ) ) (VP saw ) [ that[Complementizer] (NP (NP _ his ) rooster ) (VP was ) (AdjP sick ) ] . So Nano went to Paulus' house. Then he said to Paulus, “Come to my pen to look at my rooster. My rooster is sick!” So Paulus put a cloth on his face so that he wouldn't catch the disease. And he also put gloves on his hands so that he wouldn't catch the disease. Then Nano also put a cloth on his face so that he wouldn't catch the disease. Then Nano and Paulus put all of the healthy chickens in the pen.~!~(NP Paulus ) (VP put ) (NP the[Pre-Nominal] rooster [ that[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP was ) (AdjP sick ) ] ) (NP in a[Pre-Nominal] (AdjP special ) cage ) . and (NP Paulus ) (VP (AdvP also ) put ) (NP (AdjP three ) chicken+s[Plural] ) (NP in a[Pre-Nominal] basket ) [ because (NP he ) (VP thought ) [ that[Complementizer] (NP they ) (VP had ) (NP Avian_Influenza ) ] ] . then (NP Nano ) (NP and Paulus ) (VP put ) (NP (AdjP all of ) the[Pre-Nominal] (AdjP healthy ) chicken+s[Plural] ) (NP in the[Pre-Nominal] pen ) .
Then Paulus and Nano went to the stream. Paulus washed his hands with soap thoroughly. And Nano also washed his hands with soap thoroughly. Then Paulus went to his house. And Nano went to his house.

The other people who were living in the village heard about Nano's rooster and his chickens. So they put their chickens in pens. They didn't want their chickens to be close to the three chickens that were sick.~!~(NP the[Article] (AdjP other ) people [ who[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP were liv+ing[Participle] ) (NP in the[Article] village ) ] ) (VP heard ) (NP about (NP _ Nano+`s[Saxon_Genitive] ) rooster ) (NP and (NP _ his ) chicken+s[Plural] ) . so (NP they ) (VP put ) (NP (NP _ their ) chicken+s[Plural] ) (NP in pen+s[Plural] ) . Paulus and Nano took to town the rooster that died. A veterinarian named Agus worked at the clinic. Paulus and Nano showed that rooster to Agus. After Agus examined that rooster, he said, “I think that this rooster died because of Avian Influenza. I'll burn this rooster.”

Then Agus said, “You have to do these things. Take these gloves and this jar of bleach to your village. Clean all of your pens with this bleach. Tomorrow I'll go to your village and examine your pens. And I will give vaccine to all of the chickens that are healthy.”~!~then (NP Agus ) (VP said ) [ ,_“ (NP you ) (VP have_to[Pre-Verbal] do ) (NP these[Pre-Nominal] thing+s[Plural] ) ] . Then Paulus and Nano returned to the village. Before Paulus and Nano entered the village, they went to the stream. Paulus washed his hands with soap thoroughly. And Nano also washed his hands with soap thoroughly. Paulus and Nano didn't want to carry germs to the village.

Paulus called all of the people who lived in Terpen. So all of the people came to Nano's house. Then Paulus and Nano told the people about the things that Agus said. Then one half of the people worked with Paulus. And the other people worked with Nano.~!~(NP Paulus ) (VP call+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP (AdjP all of ) the[Pre-Nominal] people [ who[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP liv+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP in Terpen ) ] ) . so (NP (AdjP all of ) the[Pre-Nominal] people ) (VP came ) (NP to (NP _ Nano+`s[Saxon_Genitive] ) house ) . then (NP Paulus ) (NP and Nano ) (VP told ) (NP the[Pre-Nominal] people ) (NP about the[Pre-Nominal] thing+s[Plural] [ that[Relativizer] (NP Agus ) (VP said ) (NP ) ] ) . then (NP (AdjP one_half of ) the[Pre-Nominal] people ) (VP work+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP with Paulus ) . and (NP the[Pre-Nominal] (AdjP other ) people ) (VP work+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP with Nano ) .

The people put cloths on their faces and put gloves on their hands. Then they killed all of Nano's chickens and put them in that hole. Then they burned those chickens. Then they went to each house that was in the village. They caught all of the chickens that lived in the village. After a person examined a chicken, he washed his hands to prevent the disease from spreading. The people finished examining chickens at Nano's house. Paulus and the people who worked with him met Nano and the people who worked with him at his house.

The people saw that the other chickens weren't sick. So they were happy.~!~(NP the[Pre-Nominal] people ) (VP saw ) [ that[Complementizer] (NP the[Pre-Nominal] (AdjP other ) chicken+s[Plural] ) (VP were not[Post-Verbal] ) (AdjP sick ) ] . so (NP they ) (VP were ) (AdjP happy ) .

After the people finished examining all of the chickens, their owners put bleach and water into buckets. Then they cleaned the pens of their chickens. Then all of the people went to the stream. They washed their clothes with soap thoroughly and also washed themselves with soap. They were very tired. The next morning Agus came to the village. He washed his hands with soap. Then he put special clothes on. He put a cloth on his face and put gloves on his hands. Then he started giving vaccine to the chickens.

After Agus gave vaccine to all of the chickens, he said to the people, “Yesterday you cleaned your pens well. Your chickens are very healthy. But your chickens have to stay in the pens. Please examine your chickens each day. If you see a chicken that is sick, put it in a special cage. Then please immediately tell me about that chicken. If you see a person who is sick, please tell me about him. Don't allow other people to bring to your village chickens that are sick. And don't allow other people to bring to your village animals that are sick.”

Two days later Agus returned to the village. Before Agus started examining the chickens, he put special clothes on. And he put gloves on his hands. Then he drew blood from each chicken. He also examined each chicken's beak. Then he took the blood to the clinic so that other people could examine it.

After the people finished examining the blood, Agus wrote a letter to Chief Isak. Agus wrote, “Nano's rooster had Avian Influenza. Nano's rooster died because of Avian Influenza.” Then Agus sent that letter to Chief Isak.

A few days later Nano became sick. He thought that he had a cold. So Paulus immediately examined Nano. Nano didn't go to the clinic because he didn't have a fever. But he stayed in a house alone so that other people wouldn't catch the disease. Paulus examined Nano each day.~!~(NP a_few[Pre-Nominal] days (AdvP later ) ) (NP Nano ) (VP became ) (AdjP sick ) . (NP Paulus ) (VP examin+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP Nano ) (NP (AdjP each ) day ) .

Nano had a daughter named Nina. Nina was two years old. One day she became sick. She had a fever and was breathing quickly. And Nina's nose was running. Nano knew that Nina had touched the three chickens that were sick. So Nano, his wife, and Paulus took Nina to the clinic because they thought that she might have Avian Influenza.

A nurse who worked at the clinic said that Nina has to stay there for ten days. Nina's mother also stayed at the clinic to take care of her. So Paulus and Nano returned to the village. Then Paulus said to Nano, “You and your children have to stay at your house for ten days. If a person becomes sick, immediately call me.”

The nurses who worked at the clinic put Nina in a special room because they wanted to take care of her. Nina became very sick. But the nurses helped Nina become well. Then Nina's mother brought her to the village.

The other people who lived in Terpen didn't become sick. And the other chickens that were in Terpen didn't become sick. One month later the people who lived in the village helped Nano clean the pen of his chickens. Then they gave one rooster and some chickens to Nano. But they continued examining all of the chickens that were in the village. And they continued chasing away the birds that ate food with the chickens. And they didn't allow other people to bring to the village chickens that were sick.~!~(NP the[Pre-Nominal] (AdjP other ) people [ who[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP liv+ed[Past_Tense] ) (NP in Terpen ) ] ) (VP didn`t[Pre-Verbal] become ) (AdjP sick ) . and (NP the[Pre-Nominal] (AdjP other ) chicken+s[Plural] [ that[Relativizer] (NP ) (VP were ) (NP in Terpen ) ] ) (VP didn`t[Pre-Verbal] become ) (AdjP sick ) . You have to protect your chickens and your animals from this disease. You have to work with the other people who live in your village. You and the other people who live in your village have to learn about this disease. If you prevent this disease from spreading, your animals will be healthy.~!~(NP you ) (VP have_to[Pre-Verbal] protect ) (NP (NP _ your ) chicken+s[Plural] ) (NP and (NP _ your ) animal+s[Plural] ) (NP from this[Proximity] disease ) . You have to do these things to prevent Avian Influenza from killing you and your animals.~!~(NP you ) (VP have_to[Pre-Verbal] do ) (NP these[Proximity] thing+s[Plural] ) [ to (NP ) (VP prevent ) (NP Avian_Influenza ) [ from[Complementizer] (NP ) (VP kill+ing[Participle] ) (NP you ) (NP and (NP _ your ) animal+s[Plural] ) ] ] .

1) When you buy chickens and ducks at the market, you have to be very careful. Chickens and ducks have Avian Influenza often. When you cut the meat, use a special board. You have to put only raw meat on that board. You must not put meat that you cooked on that board. After you cook the meat, wash your hands with soap thoroughly.
2) When you buy eggs at the market, you have to also be careful. Before you boil the eggs, wash them thoroughly. After you touch the eggs, wash your hands with soap.

3) You have to cook meat very well. Before you eat the meat, examine it. If you see blood, you have to cook the meat thoroughly. If you eat blood, you might become sick. 4) After you cook the meat, put it on a clean plate. You have to wash the plate that the raw meat touches. Then you have to dry the plate.~!~3) (NP you ) (VP have_to[Pre-Verbal] cook ) (NP meat ) (AdvP very[Degree] well ) . 6) If your chickens are sick, you must not sell them at the market. If your chickens are sick, you must not sell the eggs at the market. If you see a person selling chickens that are sick, don't buy them.
7) If Avian Influenza is in your village, don't go to meetings. If people who are sick go to those meetings, you might catch this disease from them.

11) Whenever you help a person who has Avian Influenza, you should put gloves on your hands. The next morning Nano's rooster was dead. So Paulus and Nano put the rooster in a plastic bag. Then Nano burned the cage where the rooster had been. The three chickens that were sick were still living. 8) If you think that you have a cold, you have to go immediately to the clinic. 9) Whenever you cough, and whenever you sneeze, you should cover your mouth with your hand. 10) If a person has a cold, he and his family have to stay at his house for ten days to prevent the disease from spreading.~!~8) [ if (NP you ) (VP think ) [ that[Complementizer] (NP you ) (VP have ) (NP a[Article] cold ) ] , ] (NP you ) (VP have_to[Pre-Verbal] go (AdvP immediately ) ) (NP to the[Article] clinic ) . 9) [ whenever (NP you ) (VP cough ) , ] [ and whenever (NP you ) (VP sneeze ) , ] (NP you ) (VP should[Pre-Verbal] cover ) (NP (NP _ your ) mouth ) (NP with (NP _ your ) hand ) . 10) [ if (NP a[Article] person ) (VP has ) (NP a[Article] cold ) , ] (NP he ) (NP and (NP _ his ) family ) (VP have_to[Pre-Verbal] stay ) (NP at (NP _ his ) house ) (NP for (AdjP ten ) days ) [ to (NP ) (VP prevent ) (NP the[Article] disease ) [ from[Complementizer] (NP ) (VP spread+ing[Participle] ) ] ] .
